Author: wrdg
Content: @HackerD√∏k scripting in DayZ isn't C at all. The syntax is roughly similar, but it ressembles C# more than C. If you can wrap your head around object oriented programming, Enforce shouldn't be hard to pick up. Most of the documentation you're going to be reading is from unpacked game files, and not everything is documented, so you'll have to interpret the logic or just ask questions; most of us here know a good majority of the ins and outs for the scripting structure behind DayZ.

Author: wrdg
Content:
This is a message I've posted here a good handful of times

> If you're familiar with C style languages then  Enforce should be easy to pick up. There really isn't too much documentation behind Enforce, but the basic guides start here:
> Syntax:
> <https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DayZ:Enforce_Script_Syntax>
> Modding Basics:
> <https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DayZ:Modding_Basics>
> Game Data Extraction & Workbench Debugging:
> <https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/DayZ:Workbench_Script_Debugging>
> I'd suggest using a text editor like VSCode, Sublime, or Atom while you're scripting, the workbench isn't always reliable and sometimes crashes, leaving your unsaved work in the garbage. Most of your learning is going to be coming from the unpacked game data, which some of the scripting has documentation, and the rest is just a bit of learning from what's written and understanding code flow. You're welcome to ask questions here once you get started, it's what most do.

Author: chambersenator
Content: @Giaxpard It's possible there's a missing "pointy bracket" "<" or ">" somewhere in your AI-spawing related XML files. So it's loading in the stuff it can, but everything after that missing bracket is seen as one long confusing part, and it skips over it. They can be a pain to track down. Try using a vanilla XMLs to isolate the problem file, then put your custom stuff back in section by section and test it. I think notepad++ has a way to track it down faster, but after this happening once I became very careful with my copy/pastes
